snippet: At NATO’s summit meeting, President Petro O. Poroshenko of Ukraine said he would seek to establish “a bilateral cease-fire” on Friday between the country’s armed forces and pro-Russian separatists.
abstract: Pres Obama and European leaders at NATO summit in Newport, Wales, prepare new round of sanctions against Russia over action in Ukraine.

byline.original: By STEVEN ERLANGER, JULIE HIRSCHFELD DAVIS and STEPHEN CASTLE
byline.contributor: David M. Herszenhorn contributed reporting from Moscow, and Carlotta Gall from Donetsk, Ukraine.

lead_paragraph: At NATO’s summit meeting, President Petro O. Poroshenko of Ukraine said he would seek to establish “a bilateral cease-fire” on Friday between the country’s armed forces and pro-Russian separatists.

headline.main: NATO Prepares New Sanctions Over Russian Action in Ukraine
headline.print_headline: NATO Prepares New Sanctions Over Russian Action in Ukraine

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
